
Alice encrypted her secret using RSA, but Pete used a modulus that's the product of two Blum primes. Can you recover her message from this ciphertext? 5384282172861873084653253967949147021254231427419012611627094255916862474686476622851955151202645358588265621338976080682921283611394019803330064868225197


The flag format is flag{...}
n=10130174380103927137055871242309070391315349160023577111406464833744258238476518319235534844429674429374963095040285095949990342890409893785288907735839421, e=5100626345785275966778225680177207528902284901973306838596293032321933174112068468934819425338071539769752166263673312096747220153791505545767345429417151
The lower 104 bits of p are: 15634743107596423498742646229981987819


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{r83cvxr1}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 5384282172861873084653253967949147021254231427419012611627094255916862474686476622851955151202645358588265621338976080682921283611394019803330064868225197
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=10130174380103927137055871242309070391315349160023577111406464833744258238476518319235534844429674429374963095040285095949990342890409893785288907735839421, e=5100626345785275966778225680177207528902284901973306838596293032321933174112068468934819425338071539769752166263673312096747220153791505545767345429417151
The lower 104 bits of p are: 15634743107596423498742646229981987819

extra_info: p=87897579894798583277668972584442121633210017838159200203603758245060861494251, q=115249753090225742722910775193846143007738798186939921283404524748316493447671, Ï†(n)=10130174380103927137055871242309070391315349160023577111406464833744258238476315171902549820103673849627184806775644147133965243768922885502295530380897500
subtype: blum_integers
